author: anmenaga
body:
## Steps to reproduce
Download [powershell-7.1.0-preview.6-linux-x64.tar.gz](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases/download/v7.1.0-preview.6/powershell-7.1.0-preview.6-linux-x64.tar.gz)
Open `powershell.config.json` in text editor

## Expected behavior

Each ExperimentalFeature is mentioned once.

## Actual behavior

There are duplicate entries for:
    "Microsoft.PowerShell.Utility.PSManageBreakpointsInRunspace",
and
    "PSDesiredStateConfiguration.InvokeDscResource"

![ExpFeatureDupEntries](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11860095/90813778-e754d380-e2dc-11ea-98c0-dafbf930385c.png)


## Environment data

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

```none
Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      7.1.0-preview.6
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    7.1.0-preview.6
OS                             Linux 5.4.0-42-generic #46~18.04.1-Ubuntu SMP Fri Jul 10 07:21:24 UTC 2020
Platform                       Unix
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0…}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0
```

comments.author: daxian-dbw
comments.body: /cc @TravisEz13 @adityapatwardhan @rjmholt This is bizarre. Any of you know what might go wrong?

comments.author: rjmholt
comments.body: Is this a static asset generated by the build, or something PowerShell creates when it first starts?

comments.author: MaximoTrinidad
comments.body:
Interesting!

But it doesn't show the duplicates when executing the "**Get-ExperimentalFeatures**" cmdlet.

![expfeaCmdlet_01_2020-08-20_17-20-01](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/19892435/90827015-7a0b6780-e309-11ea-948b-91ff97c2d1cf.jpg)

comments.author: daxian-dbw
comments.body:
@rjmholt It's an artifact generated at build time, at the end of `Start-PSBuild`.

@MaximoTrinidad I guess duplicates are tolerated.

comments.author: TravisEz13
comments.body: If duplicates are tolerated, this seems like a superficial bug.  I've moved to future.

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body:
I see the same in Windows zip package.

I guess at release build time we have extra paths to these modules and follow method enumerates its twice:
https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/b1e998046e12ebe5da9dee479f20d479aa2256d7/src/System.Management.Automation/engine/ExperimentalFeature/GetExperimentalFeatureCommand.cs#L81-L84

comments.author: TravisEz13
comments.body: That is probably a slightly worse, separate, bug.  Although, that bug may be the root cause of this one.

title: Duplicate ExperimentalFeatures entries in powershell.config.json
